\index{Edge.MultipleObjectsReturned}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{edge:edge.Edge.MultipleObjectsReturned}}\pysigline{\sphinxstrong{exception }\sphinxcode{Edge.}\sphinxbfcode{MultipleObjectsReturned}}

\index{from\_node (edge.Edge attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{edge:edge.Edge.from_node}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{Edge.}\sphinxbfcode{from\_node}}
A reference to a document that will be automatically dereferenced on
access (lazily).

Use the \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} to handle what should happen if the document
the field is referencing is deleted.  EmbeddedDocuments, DictFields and
MapFields does not support reverse\_delete\_rule and an \sphinxtitleref{InvalidDocumentError}
will be raised if trying to set on one of these Document / Field types.

The options are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
DO\_NOTHING (0)  - don't do anything (default).

\item {} 
NULLIFY    (1)  - Updates the reference to null.

\item {} 
CASCADE    (2)  - Deletes the documents associated with the reference.

\item {} 
DENY       (3)  - Prevent the deletion of the reference object.

\item {} 
PULL       (4)  - Pull the reference from a \sphinxcode{ListField} of references

\end{itemize}

Alternative syntax for registering delete rules (useful when implementing
bi-directional delete rules)

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Bar}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Document}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{content} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{StringField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{foo} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ReferenceField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{Foo}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}delete\PYGZus{}rule}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Bar}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NULLIFY}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} does not trigger pre / post delete signals to be
triggered.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\DUrole{versionmodified}{Changed in version 0.5: }added \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{to\_node (edge.Edge attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{edge:edge.Edge.to_node}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{Edge.}\sphinxbfcode{to\_node}}
A reference to a document that will be automatically dereferenced on
access (lazily).

Use the \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} to handle what should happen if the document
the field is referencing is deleted.  EmbeddedDocuments, DictFields and
MapFields does not support reverse\_delete\_rule and an \sphinxtitleref{InvalidDocumentError}
will be raised if trying to set on one of these Document / Field types.

The options are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
DO\_NOTHING (0)  - don't do anything (default).

\item {} 
NULLIFY    (1)  - Updates the reference to null.

\item {} 
CASCADE    (2)  - Deletes the documents associated with the reference.

\item {} 
DENY       (3)  - Prevent the deletion of the reference object.

\item {} 
PULL       (4)  - Pull the reference from a \sphinxcode{ListField} of references

\end{itemize}

Alternative syntax for registering delete rules (useful when implementing
bi-directional delete rules)

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Bar}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Document}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{content} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{StringField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{foo} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ReferenceField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{Foo}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}delete\PYGZus{}rule}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Bar}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NULLIFY}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} does not trigger pre / post delete signals to be
triggered.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\DUrole{versionmodified}{Changed in version 0.5: }added \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{flash\_instance module}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{flash_instance:flash_instance.FlashInstance}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{flash\_instance.}\sphinxbfcode{FlashInstance}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{mongoengine.document.EmbeddedDocument}
\index{reference (flash\_instance.FlashInstance attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{flash_instance:flash_instance.FlashInstance.reference}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{reference}}
A reference to \sphinxstyleemphasis{any} \sphinxcode{Document} subclass
that will be automatically dereferenced on access (lazily).

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Any documents used as a generic reference must be registered in the
document registry.  Importing the model will automatically register
it.

\item {} 
You can use the choices param to limit the acceptable Document types

\end{itemize}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\DUrole{versionmodified}{New in version 0.3.}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{response\_model (flashcard.Flashcard attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{flashcard:flashcard.Flashcard.response_model}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{Flashcard.}\sphinxbfcode{response\_model}}
A list field that wraps a standard field, allowing multiple instances
of the field to be used as a list in the database.

If using with ReferenceFields see: \DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{one-to-many-with-listfields}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Required means it cannot be empty - as the default for ListFields is {[}{]}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{flashcard\_instance module}
\label{\detokenize{flashcard_instance:module-flashcard_instance}}\label{\detokenize{flashcard_instance::doc}}\label{\detokenize{flashcard_instance:flashcard-instance-module}}\index{flashcard\_instance (module)}\index{FlashmapInstance (class in flashcard\_instance)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{flashcard_instance:flashcard_instance.FlashmapInstance}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{flashcard\_instance.}\sphinxbfcode{FlashmapInstance}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{flash_instance:flash_instance.FlashInstance}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{flash\_instance.FlashInstance}}}}
\index{reference (flashcard\_instance.FlashmapInstance attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{flashcard_instance:flashcard_instance.FlashmapInstance.reference}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{reference}}
A reference to a document that will be automatically dereferenced on
access (lazily).

Use the \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} to handle what should happen if the document
the field is referencing is deleted.  EmbeddedDocuments, DictFields and
MapFields does not support reverse\_delete\_rule and an \sphinxtitleref{InvalidDocumentError}
will be raised if trying to set on one of these Document / Field types.

The options are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
DO\_NOTHING (0)  - don't do anything (default).

\item {} 
NULLIFY    (1)  - Updates the reference to null.

\item {} 
CASCADE    (2)  - Deletes the documents associated with the reference.

\item {} 
DENY       (3)  - Prevent the deletion of the reference object.

\item {} 
PULL       (4)  - Pull the reference from a \sphinxcode{ListField} of references

\end{itemize}

Alternative syntax for registering delete rules (useful when implementing
bi-directional delete rules)

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Bar}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Document}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{content} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{StringField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{foo} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ReferenceField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{Foo}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}delete\PYGZus{}rule}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Bar}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NULLIFY}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} does not trigger pre / post delete signals to be
triggered.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\DUrole{versionmodified}{Changed in version 0.5: }added \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{reference (flashedge\_response.FlashedgeResponse attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{flashedge_response:flashedge_response.FlashedgeResponse.reference}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{reference}}
A reference to \sphinxstyleemphasis{any} \sphinxcode{Document} subclass
that will be automatically dereferenced on access (lazily).

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Any documents used as a generic reference must be registered in the
document registry.  Importing the model will automatically register
it.

\item {} 
You can use the choices param to limit the acceptable Document types

\end{itemize}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\DUrole{versionmodified}{New in version 0.3.}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{handler module}
\label{\detokenize{handler:module-handler}}\label{\detokenize{handler:handler-module}}\label{\detokenize{handler::doc}}\index{handler (module)}\index{handler() (in module handler)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{handler:handler.handler}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{handler.}\sphinxbfcode{handler}}{\emph{websocket}, \emph{path}}{}
Initiate an asyncio thread which receives messages from a client, parse the json file to an object, pass them to consumer() and send the result back to the client
\begin{description}
\item[{args:}] \leavevmode
websocket -- the websocket being used for receiving and sending messages to a client
path -- the IP address used to host the websocket

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{questionnaire\_response module}
\label{\detokenize{questionnaire_response:module-questionnaire_response}}\label{\detokenize{questionnaire_response::doc}}\label{\detokenize{questionnaire_response:questionnaire-response-module}}\index{questionnaire\_response (module)}\index{QuestionnaireResponse (class in questionnaire\_response)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{questionnaire_response:questionnaire_response.QuestionnaireResponse}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{questionnaire\_response.}\sphinxbfcode{QuestionnaireResponse}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{mongoengine.document.EmbeddedDocument}
\index{answer (questionnaire\_response.QuestionnaireResponse attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{questionnaire_response:questionnaire_response.QuestionnaireResponse.answer}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{answer}}
32-bit integer field.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{questionnaire\_item (questionnaire\_response.QuestionnaireResponse attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{questionnaire_response:questionnaire_response.QuestionnaireResponse.questionnaire_item}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{questionnaire\_item}}
A reference to a document that will be automatically dereferenced on
access (lazily).

Use the \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} to handle what should happen if the document
the field is referencing is deleted.  EmbeddedDocuments, DictFields and
MapFields does not support reverse\_delete\_rule and an \sphinxtitleref{InvalidDocumentError}
will be raised if trying to set on one of these Document / Field types.

The options are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
DO\_NOTHING (0)  - don't do anything (default).

\item {} 
NULLIFY    (1)  - Updates the reference to null.

\item {} 
CASCADE    (2)  - Deletes the documents associated with the reference.

\item {} 
DENY       (3)  - Prevent the deletion of the reference object.

\item {} 
PULL       (4)  - Pull the reference from a \sphinxcode{ListField} of references

\end{itemize}

Alternative syntax for registering delete rules (useful when implementing
bi-directional delete rules)

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Bar}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Document}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{content} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{StringField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{foo} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ReferenceField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{Foo}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}delete\PYGZus{}rule}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Bar}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{foo}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NULLIFY}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule} does not trigger pre / post delete signals to be
triggered.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\DUrole{versionmodified}{Changed in version 0.5: }added \sphinxtitleref{reverse\_delete\_rule}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{birthdate (user.User attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{user:user.User.birthdate}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{User.}\sphinxbfcode{birthdate}}
Datetime field.

Uses the python-dateutil library if available alternatively use time.strptime
to parse the dates.  Note: python-dateutil's parser is fully featured and when
installed you can utilise it to convert varying types of date formats into valid
python datetime objects.
\begin{description}
\item[{Note: Microseconds are rounded to the nearest millisecond.}] \leavevmode
Pre UTC microsecond support is effectively broken.
Use \sphinxcode{ComplexDateTimeField} if you
need accurate microsecond support.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{tests (user.User attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{user:user.User.tests}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{User.}\sphinxbfcode{tests}}
A list field that wraps a standard field, allowing multiple instances
of the field to be used as a list in the database.

If using with ReferenceFields see: \DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{one-to-many-with-listfields}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Required means it cannot be empty - as the default for ListFields is {[}{]}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
